body:
## What's Changed
* improves BaseDuplexConnection and fixes `PingClient` impl by @OlegDokuka in https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/1062
* ensures `SetupFrame` is available for future use by @OlegDokuka in https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/1046
* adds message counting to protect against malicious overflow by @OlegDokuka in https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/1067
* Adds reflection hints for native-image support 1.1.x by @violetagg in https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/1073
* introduces `onClose` listener for `RSocketClient` and `connect` method by @OlegDokuka in https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/1063


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/compare/1.1.2...1.1.3

name: 1.1.2 Release
body:
## What's Changed
* fixes typo in LeaseSpec initialization https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/1024
* adds first frame handling timeout https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/1027
* bumps libs versions and provides a few UnboundedProcessor fixes https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/1028
* eliminate boxing in RequesterResponderSupport when using `IntObjectMap` https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/1029
* adds tests for WeightedLoadbalanceStrategy https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/1035
* migrates from deprecated API, updates dependencies https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/1042
* adds routing example with `TaggingMetadata` and `CompositeMetadata` https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/1021
* fixes `block()` in MetadataPushRequesterMono/FnfRequesterMono https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/1044

## New Contributors
* @arodionov made their first contribution in https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/1024
* @olme04 made their first contribution in https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/1029

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/compare/1.1.1...1.1.2

name: 1.1.1 Release
body:
## :star: New Features

- Improve Lease API  [#877](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/issues/877)
- Refactor `InMemoryResumableFramesStore` and improve test coverage [#1014](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/1014)
- JCStress tests for the Requester and Responder operators [#999](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/999)
- Add per-stream MimeType extension codecs [#998](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/998)
- "Automatic-Module-Name" for each module [#1007](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/1007)

## :beetle: Bug Fixes

- Remove failed loadbalance targets from the active list [#982](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/982)
- Local and remote resume state disagreement [#973](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/issues/973)
- Fix memory Leak related to keepAlive and resume, unreleased buffers [#1009](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/issues/1009)
- Fix memory leak and add test for live lock on `queue.poll()` [#989](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/989)
- Add null-safe iteration of active streams [#1004](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/1004)
- NullPointerException on connection disposal [#914](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/issues/914)

## :notebook_with_decorative_cover: Documentation

- Update Javadoc for load-balancing [#1000](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/1000)

## :hammer: Other

- Fully migrate tests to JUnit 5 [#1016](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/1016)
- Replace use of deprecated MonoProcessor API [#1003](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/1003)
- Replace use of deprecated Processor APIs [#957](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/issues/957)
- Fix LoadbalanceTest issues [#983](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/983)
- Updates sample code in RSocketConnector Javadoc [#977](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/977)
- Upgrade to Reactor 2020.0.4 [#981](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/981)

## :heart: Contributors

We'd like to thank all the contributors who worked on this release!

- [@rudy2steiner](https://github.com/rudy2steiner)
- [@making](https://github.com/making)

name: 1.0.5 Release
body:
## :beetle: Bug Fixes

- Replace use of deprecated RaceTestUtils and fix resulting exposed issues [#1008](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/1008)

## :hammer: Other

- Expose number of race test iterations as an environment variable [#1015](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/1015)

name: 1.0.4 Release
body:
## :star: New Features

- Fix performance degradation when fragmentation is used [#995](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/995)

## :beetle: Bug Fixes

- Fix deadlock on multiconsumer clear/poll in UnboundedProcessor [#990](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/990)
- Fix `OverflowException` if `UnicastProcessor` request and onNext are in a race [#985](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/985)
- Fix `RequestOperator` to subscribe to the source at later phase [#963](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/963)
- Ensure `DeafultPayload#create` methods make a copy of `ByteBuf` content [#993](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/993)
- Ensure `Subscriber` is removed from sendingSubscriptions [#962](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/962)

## :hammer: Other

- Upgrade to Reactor Dysprosium-SR17 and Netty 4.1.59 [#980](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/980)

## :heart: Contributors

We'd like to thank all the contributors who worked on this release!

- [@koldat](https://github.com/koldat)

name: 1.1.0 Release
body:
## :star: New Features

- Provide request intercepting api [#944](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/944)
- Migrate weighted loadbalance strategy to user new  RequestInterceptors for Stats tracking [#946](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/946)
- Update WeightedLoadbalanceStrategy to use a Builder [#949](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/949)

## :beetle: Bug Fixes

- Improve Loadbalance implementations and test coverage [#953](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/953)
- LoadBalancedRSocketMono (LatencySubscriber) does not seem to propagate subscriber context properly [#822](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/issues/822)
- Load balancer throwing several exceptions when refreshing available sockets [#786](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/issues/786)
- LoadBalancedRSocketMono loose sockets on server restart [#633](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/issues/633)

## :hammer: Other

- Upgrade to Reactor 2020.0.0 [#952](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/issues/952)

name: 1.0.3 Release
body:
## :star: New Features

- Avoid queueing in UnicastProcessor receivers [#932](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/932)
- Update username length to align with the spec (uint8 vs uint16) [#938](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/938)
- Use heap buffers in the default payload decoder [#945](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/945)

## :beetle: Bug Fixes

- Safer iteration when cancelling subscriptions [#941](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/941)

## :hammer: Other

- Upgrade to Reactor Dysprosium-SR13 [#951](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/issues/951)
- Dependencies for 1.1.0-M02 missing from Maven Central? [#940](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/issues/940)
- Use static errors in RSocket default method implementations [#933](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/933)

## :heart: Contributors

We'd like to thank all the contributors who worked on this release!

- [@freelancer1845](https://github.com/freelancer1845)
- [@SerCeMan](https://github.com/SerCeMan)

name: 1.1.0-RC1 Release
body:
## :star: New Features

- Resume mechanism improvements & refactor [#766](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/issues/766)

## :beetle: Bug Fixes

- Ensures that resumability implementation is stable [#934](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/934)
- Resume related Netty ByteBuf leak [#779](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/issues/779)

## :hammer: Other

- Upgrade to Reactor 2020.0 RC2 [#943](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/issues/943)

name: 1.1.0-M2 Release
body:
## :star: New Features

- Improve DuplexConnection api and rework Resumability [#923](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/923)
- Changes LoadbalanceStrategy to accept List [#919](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/919)
- Expose remote address via DuplexConnection [#929](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/929)
- Ability to intercept requests and access channel information such as remote address [#735](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/issues/735)

## :beetle: Bug Fixes

- Ensure RRRSubscriber doesn't cancel subscription on onNext [#918](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/918)

## :hammer: Other

- Make LoadbalanceStrategy implementations public [#928](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/928)

name: 1.1.0-M1 Release
body:
## :star: New Features

- Introduces RSocketClient as way to use RSocket from the connector side [#850](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/850)
- Provides new Loadbalancer implementation [#899](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/899)
- Implements dedicated `Publisher`/`Subscriber` for each request type #761 [#761](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/761)
- Reworks multiplexer and improves tests to check async interceptors #909 [#909](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/909)
- Improves ref-counting by eliminating redundant retain/release [#902](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/902)
- Reject frames less than min MTU size [#913](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/913)

## :hammer: Other

- Removes deprecations dedicated for 1.1 [#906](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/906)
- Upgrade to Reactor 2020.0.0-M2 [#890](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/issues/890)

name: 1.0.2 Release
body:
## :star: New Features

- Reject any frames before SETUP/LEASE [#904](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/904)
- Reject empty fragments [#903](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/903)
- RSocket server is subject to empty frames flood denial-of-service [#895](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/issues/895)
- provides setup for `maxInboundPayloadSize` and `maxFrameSize` [#876](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/876)

## :beetle: Bug Fixes

- fixes extra Payload release on racing complete and cancel [#894](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/894)
- fixes `DefaultPayload.create(ByteBuf, ByteBuf)` to release params [#886](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/886)

## :notebook_with_decorative_cover: Documentation

- provides an example of peer to peer communication [#868](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/868)

name: 1.0.1 Release
body:
## :star: New Features

- Exposes API for the full customization of websocket sending / handling [#835](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/835)

## :beetle: Bug Fixes

- Provides error handling in case Bubbling / NIC exceptions [#863](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/863)
- Fixes responder to handle errors according to the spec [#861](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/861)
- Fixes ConnectionSetupPayload refcnt management [#854](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/854)
- Ensures streams are terminated if racing terminal and new stream [#848](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/848)
- Fixes ReconnectMono behaviour when racing invalidate and subscribe #847 [#847](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/847)
- Bugfix `RSocketConnector#setupPayload` to copy the content [#843](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/843)

## :notebook_with_decorative_cover: Documentation

- RSocketClient and RSocketConnector Javadoc update [#856](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/856)
- Provides well documented lease example [#840](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/840)
- Update WebSocketHeadersSample [#839](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/839)

## :hammer: Other

- Ensures there is no extra logging about a dropped error [#859](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/859)
- Ensures lease is used exactly on request frame sending [#855](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/855)
- Forward compatibility with Reactor Netty 1.0 [#851](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/851)
- Apply FragmentationDuplexConnection from a single place [#836](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/836)

name: 1.0.0 Release
body:
## :star: New Features

- Includes LimitRateInterceptor as a built-in interceptor [#834](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/834)
- Provides `bindNow` shortcut for the server [#830](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/830)
- Removes limit rate operator [#829](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/829)
- Provides support for TracingMetadata [#824](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/824)
- Renames Flyweight classes to Codec [#820](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/820)
- Relaxed stream id supplement  [#814](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/814)
- Provides `Payload` `refCnt` verification [#809](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/809)
- Deprecate AbstractRSocket and provide alternative [#805](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/805)
- Add Zipkin Tracing Flyweight [#583](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/issues/583)

## :beetle: Bug Fixes

- Fxes onClose behaviour to not error on shutdown [#833](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/833)
- Provides ordered stream id issuing [#811](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/811)
- Adds missing NPE catch in order to handle rare racing cases [#808](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/808)
- NullPointerException on stream cancellation  [#757](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/issues/757)
- Requests may have non-sequential stream ids [#749](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/issues/749)

## :notebook_with_decorative_cover: Documentation

- Provides extra `@NonNullApi` annotation for all packages [#826](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/826)
- Add Javadoc to RSocketConnector and RSocketServer [#813](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/813)

## :hammer: Other

- Removes deprecated errorConsumer [#832](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/832)
- Provides supportive class to hide concurrency complexity [#807](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/807)
- Reduces maintenance complexity [#806](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/806)
- Removes TupleByteBufs [#804](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/804)
- Deprecate ResponderRSocket [#802](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/802)
- Rename `XXXFlyweight` in `frames` package to `XXXCodec` [#787](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/issues/787)

name: 1.0.0-RC7 Release
body:
## :star: New Features

- Deprecate ResumeStrategy and replace with Reactor Retry [#798](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/798)
- Send root-cause errors from connection to onClose of RSocket [#797](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/797)
- Consolidate use of single `ByteBufAllocator` exposed from the transport [#796](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/796)
- Fixes Payload#hasMetadata to strictly match the flag in the frame [#783](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/783)
- Add RSocketConnector and RSocketServer as replacements for RSocketFactory [#780](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/780)
- Support for reconnectable, shared Mono<RSocket> [#759](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/759)
- Provides Prioritised delivering of Zero Streams Frames [#718](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/718)

## :beetle: Bug Fixes

- Provides more `ByteBuf` leaks fixes [#803](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/803)
- Apply recent changes in UnicastProcessor to UnboundedProcessor related to buffer leaks  [#799](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/799)
- Fixes requestChannel to ensure support of half-closed state [#794](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/794)
- Use doOnDiscard to release cached Payloads [#777](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/777)
- Enforces reassembly of fragments to always be in enabled [#775](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/775)
- Pre-validate Payload length at stream level to avoid closing connection  [#768](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/768)
- NullPointerException on stream cancellation  [#757](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/issues/757)
- Fixes behavior of RequestChannel  [#736](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/736)

## :hammer: Other

- Default errorConsumer to no-op in the new API [#801](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/801)
- Fix logging in examples and load-balancer tests [#800](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/800)
- Drop UriHandler and UriTransportRegistry [#795](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/795)
- Avoid sending of redundant ERROR and CANCEL frames [#792](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/792)
- Upgrade to Reactor Dysprosium-SR7 [#789](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/issues/789)
- Remove package cycles involving lease, internal, exception, and frame [#774](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/774)
- Move RSocketFactory implementation to core sub-package to avoid dependencies from top-level package [#770](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/770)
- Provides support for the JDK 14 based builds [#763](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/763)
- Disables gradle modules feature [#751](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/751)
- Provides rollback to CompositeByteBuf usage [#750](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/750)
- Add MESSAGE_RSOCKET_MIMETYPE and MESSAGE_RSOCKET_ACCEPT_MIMETYPES [#744](https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket-java/pull/744)

name: Release 1.0.0-RC6: Auth Metadata Extension Support & Bugfixes
body: This release provides support for Auth Metadata Extension support as well as provides a couple of bugfixes for `TupleByteBuf`

name: Update to Reactor Dysprosium M3 and Bug fixes
CompositeMetadata and Bug Fixes
body:
Implementation of CompositeMetadata Extension - https://github.com/rsocket/rsocket/blob/master/Extensions/CompositeMetadata.md

Fixes bugs found with fragmentation

name: Fix framing error
body: Fixes out of bounds errors with framing

name: Request Channel Bug, ByteBuf Optimizations, Fragmentation Fix
body:
Fixes a bug in a request channel with long running streams where the channel would stop emitting data

Fixes a bug in fragmentation when the mtu is 64 bytes that caused an illegal refcnt exception

Replaces compositebytebufs with specialized ByteBuf tuples of 2 and 3

name: Major bugfixes and new API in server's RSocketFactory setup
body: This release provides some major bugfixes related to the connection closing and introduces a more flexible way to convert RSocketFactory.receiver() to ServerTransport.ConnectionAcceptor, hence easily integrate with WebsocketRoutingTransport and existing HttpClient

name: Maintenance Release. Improves stability and provides some bugfixes
add fragmentation support using new frames
fix metadata frame fragmentation
body: Fixes fragmentation when metadata frame isn't present was leading to an out of bounds Exception.  Takes into account a metadata frame not being present.

name: optimized channel handler
body: Adds an interface that allows implementers to peek at a channel's first request. The interface is called ResponderRSocket.

name: performance improvements and load balancer fixes
body:
Load balancer will reconnect to downstream connections now
Performance improvements to rsocket-core
Performance improvements to rsocket-transport-netty

name: Minimal fix for stream disconnect issue, verified
Fix for connections not terminating
body: include reactor changes

name: Fix for connections not terminating
body: Fix current and future streams not terminating after connection dispose

name: Californium-SR1
body:
Align with Reactor-Californium-SR1
Cleanup gradle setup

name: Reimplementation of keep-alives according to spec
Null Pointer Fix
body: Prevents null pointer exception from being throw when Frame is being released

name: Maven Dependency Improvements
body: Previously, an update the build system resulted in the Maven dependencies being aggressively calculated, before each project add dependencies to itself. This change updates the ordering of this calculation such that it happens after each project configures itself. In addition, this change goes through each project and ensures that the dependencies are scoped appropriately in order to achieve the a minimal and accurate Maven POM.

name: Update dependencies, various improvements
body:
Remove nested flatMap in RSocketFactory (#493)
Local Transport Improvements (#489)
Fix Reference Count Leak (#488)
Migration of Spectator to Micrometer (#486)
Fragmentation (#481)

name: Replace IntObjectHashMap with NonBlockingHashMapLong
body: Replace IntObjectHashMap with NonBlockingHashMapLong - prevents an exception being thrown when cleaning up connections on the RSocketClient.

name: Replace IntObjectHashMap with NonBlockingHashMapLong
body: Netty's IntObjectHashMap does not have thread safe iterators, replace with NonBlockingHashMapLong from JCTools so connections get cleaned up reliably

name: Closeable interface implements Disposable
body: Closeable implements Disposable now as removes the close method that returns a Mono.

name: cleanup
body: RSocketClient cleans up connections properly now, and disposes subscriptions.

name: Recycle payloads refcnt
body: Increments refcnt when retrieving recycled payload

name: Recycle payloads
body: Recycles the ByteBufPayload because it is RefCnt

name: Zero Copy
body: RSocket was copying the metadata and data fields when return them to the call. This lets you use a FrameDecoder so you can get the ByteBuf and return zero copies. In the TCP ping/pong test increases performances ~38% and lowers tail latency ~100 ms.

name: Handle Errors properly
body: When a server receives an Error frame it no longer closes the connection.

name: SwitchTransform IllegalStateException
body: Fixes SwitchTransform so that it doesn't throw an IllegalStateException

name: Fixes channel streaming
body: Address issues with streaming with channels

name: Fixed onClose
body: Netty duplex connections no longer solely rely on events from Netty to close - ensures that onClose events are propogated

name: Frame ordering
body: Emits frames in correct order when multiple threads on next-ing to send processor.
working on release uploads
Working on getting releases working again.
Release to test publishing, master of 1.0.x branch

name: flux and bytebuf
body:
Refactored to use Reactor-core Flux. 
Switches frame to use ByteBuf instead of DirectBuffer
Trying to get releases working (and keep snapshots working)
#82 adding a callback when a reactive socket is closed

name: v0.0.3
body: Release to Maven Central

name: v0.0.2 - 2016-03-07
body:
- Fix request-n logic bug for channel.
- Revert requestChannel signature

name: v0.0.1
body: First released version.
